DOC.HEAD: Summary of Events
Eds: Updates with battles continuing, key officials arrested, other details.
DOC.TEXT: Here is a brief summary of events in Romania: _The 24-year reign of President Nicolae Ceausescu collapsed as a citizen uprising was joined by rebellious troops. A top defense official who joined the rebels said they controlled most of the country, with only scattered resistance. _Ceausescu and his wife, Elena, fled the presidential palace by helicopter. Some reports said they had been arrested; others indicated their whereabouts were unknown. _Ceausescu's son, the interior minister, the chief of the secret police and other key figures of the regime were arrested. _Fighting continued into Saturday between rebel troops and security forces loyal to Ceausescu in Bucharest and elsewhere in the country. _Hundreds were reported killed in the fighting, in addition to the thousands believed killed earlier in the week of unrest. _A National Salvation Committee was formed to run the country temporarily. _Jubilant Romanians rallied in Bucharest and throughout the country. _Hundreds of people dug up mass graves near Timisoara, in western Romania, in search of as many as 4,500 people killed last weekend when protesters were massacred by security forces. _The Bush administration said a ``terrible burden'' had been lifted from the Romanian people and expressed hope for a peaceful transition to democracy. _The European Community foreign ministers pledged immediate aid to Romania and the Red Cross in Geneva flew four tons of medical supplies to Bucharest.
